DataElement.preferredName: Diphtheria Tetanus Toxoid Vaccine Previous Administration Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown response to indicate if the Diphtheria Tetanus Toxoid vaccine was previously administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diphtheria Tetanus Toxoid Vaccine Previous Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Gram-positive bacterial infection caused by Corynebacterium diphtheriae. It usually involves the oral cavity, pharynx, and nasal cavity. Patients develop pseudomembranes in the affected areas and manifest signs and symptoms of an upper respiratory infection. The diphtheria toxin may cause myocarditis, polyneuritis, and other systemic effects._A substance that is derived from the toxin released by the bacterium that causes the disease tetanus.  It is used as a vaccine to prevent tetanus or to help boost the immune response to other vaccines._Occurring prior to something else._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Gram-positive bacterial infection caused by Corynebacterium diphtheria. It usually involves the oral cavity, pharynx, and nasal cavity. Patients develop pseudomembranes in the affected areas and manifest signs and symptoms of an upper respiratory infection. The diphtheria toxin may cause myocarditis, polyneuritis, and other systemic effects.:A substance that is derived from the toxin released by the bacterium that causes the disease tetanus.  It is used as a vaccine to prevent tetanus or to help boost the immune response to other vaccines.

Concepts.definition: A Gram-positive bacterial infection caused by Corynebacterium diphtheriae. It usually involves the oral cavity, pharynx, and nasal cavity. Patients develop pseudomembranes in the affected areas and manifest signs and symptoms of an upper respiratory infection. The diphtheria toxin may cause myocarditis, polyneuritis, and other systemic effects.

A preparation of formaldehyde-deactivated toxin isolated from the bacterium Clostridium tetani. Tetanus toxoid is used for booster injection and can stimulate the production of antitoxin antibodies. This agent may be used as an adjuvant in cancer vaccines.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring prior to something else.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the participant received
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant received a Tetanus-Diphtheria (Td) vaccination within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant received a Tetanus-Diphtheria (Td) or Tdap vaccine within the past 6 months?
